#Text=Ramla
#Text=Ramla is a city in central Israel , between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Ramla was the only new city to be founded within the current boundaries of Israel during about 1,200 years of Muslim rule ; in all other cases , they were built on top of preexisting cities .
#Text=Today it has a mixed Arab and Jewish population of 66,000 people .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Buses run frequently from Jerusalem , Tel Aviv , Modiin , and other cities in central Israel , as well as Beer Sheva .
#Text=Ramla Central Bus station .
#Text=By train
#Text=Ramla train station .
#Text=Trains run once an hour to Tel Aviv , Beit Shemesh , and Jerusalem .
#Text=The station sits on the site of a 19th century stop along the original line but has seen significant renovation and new construction int the 21st century
#Text=Get around
#Text=All sites of interest to tourists are within a 15-minute walk of the central bus station .
#Text=Inside Ramla , Kavim operates four local bus lines ( 4 , 5 , 7 , 8 ) , and three lines to Lod ( 11 , 13 , 15 ) .
#Text=Bus line 25 can be also used for local service inside Ramla .
#Text=See
#Text=Tower of Ramla ( the White Tower ) . was built in the 13th century .
#Text=It served as the minaret of the White Mosque ( al-Masjid al-Abyad ) erected by Caliph Suleiman in the 8th century CE , of which only remnants remain today .
#Text=The tower is six stories high , with a spiral staircase of 119 steps .
#Text=You may be able to walk up to the top , where there are great views of the Tel Aviv area .
#Text=Arches Pool .
#Text=An underground water reservoir with impressive arches holding up its roof .
#Text=Built in the 8th century .
#Text=You can get in a rowboat and paddle underground between the arches .
#Text=Highly recommended , especially on hot days , as the pool remains cool . ₪14 .
#Text=Great Mosque ( Al-Omri Mosque ) , ☏ +9728 922-5081 .
#Text=Built as a Crusader church , this building was converted into a mosque by the Mameluks , and is still used as a mosque today .
#Text=The building is quite impressive .
#Text=Call ahead of time to arrange a visit .
#Text=₪7 .
#Text=Ramla Museum .
#Text=Describes Ramla 's history .

#Text=The building , from 1922 , incorporates elements of Arab architecture such as arched windows and patterned tiled floors , and is the former municipal headquarters of the British Mandatory authorities .
#Text=The old city next to the market is an abandoned area of old buildings dating to the Ottoman period and earlier .
#Text=British military cemetery .
#Text=Best known for the grave of a soldier named Harry Potter , who was killed in the Arab revolt against the British in 1939 .
#Text=The grave reportedly receives many visitors each year on July 31 , which is the birthday of the fictional Harry Potter .
#Text=Truck and Transport Museum , HaHazon 2 , Industrial Area B. An outdoor museum housing a large variety of old trucks ( lorries ) .
#Text=Lots of fun for kids .
#Text=Open every day , free entry .
#Text=Go to the lobby of the Taavurah company offices , ask the guard for the museum key .
#Text=Unshaded , so it might not be good for a hot day .
#Text=The Hospice of St. Nicodemus and St. Joseph of Arimathea ( Franciscan Church ) .
#Text=On Ramla 's main boulevard , Herzl Street , is easily recognized by its clock-faced , square tower .
#Text=It belongs to the Franciscan church .
#Text=Napoleon used the hospice as his headquarters during his Palestine campaign in 1799 .
#Text=The church houses Israel 's only painting by Tizian .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Ramla 's market , Jabotinsky street .
#Text=Ramla Mall , 1 David Raziel street , ☏ +972 8-6701111 , fax : +972 8-9106170 .
#Text=The mall is also known as Azrieli Ramla Mall .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Lod - Next to Ramla , it is quite similar as a place to live , but has fewer attractions for visitors .
#Text=Rishon LeZion - the major city between Ramla and Tel Aviv
#Text=Modi'in - the major city between Ramla and Jerusalem
#Text=Jaffa - The southeastern part of Tel aviv , and close atmosphere to Ramla
